channel.title: DuckDB on MCP Toolbox for Databases
channel.description: Recent content in DuckDB on MCP Toolbox for Databases

item.title: DuckDB SQL Tools
item.description:
About

A duckdb-sql tool executes SQL statements against a DuckDB database. It is compatible with any DuckDB source configuration as defined in the DuckDB source documentation.

DuckDB uses the ? placeholder for parameters in SQL statements. Parameters are bound in the order they are provided. The statement field supports any valid DuckDB SQL statement, including SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE/ALTER/DROP table statements, and other DDL statements.

DuckDB’s SQL dialect closely follows the conventions of the PostgreSQL dialect, with a few exceptions listed in the DuckDB PostgreSQL Compatibility documentation. For an introduction to DuckDB’s SQL dialect, refer to the DuckDB SQL Introduction.
